name: Rust
title: The Rust quick reference cheat sheet that aims at providing help on writing basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: The Rust quick reference cheat sheet that aims at providing help on writing basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: Hello_World.rs
Hello_World.rs
cards.body: #### Compiling and Running

cards.title: Hello_World.rs
cards.code:
$ rustc Hello_World.rs
$ ./Hello_World
Hello, World!

cards.title: Primitive types
cards.body: See: [Rust Types](#rust-types)

cards.title: Formatting
Formatting
cards.body:
// Multiple Placeholder
println!("{} {}", 1, 3);

cards.title: Formatting
Formatting
Formatting
cards.body:
// Placeholder traits :b for binary, :0x is for hex and :o is octal
println!("Let us print 76 is binary which is {:b} , and hex equivalent is {:0x} and octal equivalent is {:o}", 76, 76, 76);

cards.body: println!("The name of the community is {community_name} and it has {no_of_members} members");

cards.title: Mutable Array
Mutable Array
cards.body: Use the `mut` keyword to make it mutable.

cards.title: Slices
Vectors
cards.code: let some_vector = vec![1, 2, 3, 4, 5];

cards.title: Vectors
cards.body: A vector is declared using the `vec!` macro.

cards.title: Tuples
cards.code: let tuple = (1, 'A', "Cool", 78, true);

cards.title: String Literal
String Object
.capacity()
cards.code:
let rand = String::from("Random String");
rand.capacity() // => 13

cards.title: .capacity()
cards.body: Calculates the capacity of the string in bytes.

cards.title: .contains()
cards.code:
let name = String::from("ElementalX");
name.contains("Element") // => true

cards.title: .contains()
cards.body: Checks if the substring is contained inside the original string or not.

cards.title: Pushing a single character
cards.code:
let mut half_text = String::from("Hal");
half_text.push('f'); // => Half

cards.title: Pushing an entire String
Comparison Operators
cards.back: `e` is less than or equal to `f`

cards.title: Comparison Operators
cards.code:
let (e, f) = (1, 100);

let greater = f > e;        // => true
let less = f < e;           // => false
let greater_equal = f >= e; // => true
let less_equal = e <= f;    // => true
let equal_to = e == f;      // => false
let not_equal_to = e != f;  // => true

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.back: Gets remainder of `a` by dividing with `b`

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.body:
```rust {.wrap}
let (a, b) = (4, 5);

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.body:
let sum: i32 = a + b;            // => 9
let subtractions: i32 = a - b;   // => -1
let multiplication: i32 = a * b; // => 20
let division: i32 = a / b;       // => 0
let modulus: i32 = a % b;        // => 4

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.code: ### Bitwise Operators | Operator | Description | | ------------------- | ----------------------- | | `g & h` | Binary AND | | g \| h | Binary OR | | `g ^ h` | Binary XOR | | `!g` | Binary one's complement | | `g << h` | Binary shift left | | `g >> h` | Binary shift right | --- ```rust {.wrap} let (g, h) = (0x1, 0x2); let bitwise_and = g & h; // => 0 let bitwise_or = g | h; // => 3 let bitwise_xor = g ^ h; // => 3 let right_shift = g >> 2; // => 0 let left_shift = h << 4; // => 32

cards.title: Logical Operators
cards.code:
let (c, d) = (true, false);

let and = c && d;  // => false
let or = c || d;   // => true
let not = !c;      // => false

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.code:
let mut k = 9;
let mut l = k;

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.back: Add a value and assign, then k=18

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.back: Subtract a value and assign, then k=0

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.back: Divide a value and assign, then k=1

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.back: Multiply a value and assign, then k=81

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.back: = l | Bitwise OR and assign, then k=89
